h4. Summary
Currently it's not possible to search for comments in a way that only public or internal comments will be filtered. In many cases this would be useful for project admins and/or service desk agents to manage the service desks better.

h4. Suggestion
Provide a JQL function which is able to differentiate between public and internal comments.
fields.summary: Provide JQL to search for public vs. internal comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4285].
  {panel}

When a customer has lots of active issues on the customer portal, it is really hard to see if there has been any updates to any of them. Customer has to open each issue and go through them. Or he will needs to be dependent on reading every mail from the service desk. 

Suggestions to solve it:
* Making it possible to search by update date
* Mark issues with "updated" that has been updated the last X number of days
* Show an activity stream of recent activities in my issues.
fields.summary: Mark recently updated issues on Customer portal

fields.description:

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk Cloud: 3.3.0-OD-1000.335.0

h3. Steps to reproduce

# Upload an attachment

h3. Expected Result
*Add* button is enabled.

h3. Actual Result

!Screenshot1.jpeg|thumbnail!

# Remove the texts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4283].
  {panel}

h4. +Scenario+
In some cases a SD project may be linked with a Dev Tool e.g. Bitbucket and some SD tickets might have Commits related to them. In these cases, only those users who have both JIRA Software and JIRA Service Desk application access are able to view the Development Panel in the SD tickets.

h4. +Suggestion+
A user with application access to JIRA Software should be able to view the Development Panel in SD tickets without application access to JIRA Service Desk. In other words, this permission should be added to the list of [what JIRA Software users can do in an SD project|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER032/Setting+up+service+desk+users#Settingupservicedeskusers-limitedInvolvingJIRASoftwareandJIRACoreusers].

h4. +Notes+
(i) Permission Helper says a Software user without SD application access is not allowed to View Development Tools (which is correct by current design):
!YesSwNoSD.png|thumbnail!

(!) However, though it says an SD user without Software application access is allowed to View Development Tools, the user indeed cannot:
!NoSwYesSD.png|thumbnail!
, which means:
* the message is *incorrect*
* JIRA Software application access is a must

(/) Considering the above, Software access is more important than SD access to view development tools, so a Software user without SD application access should be able to view development tools.
fields.summary: Software users should be able to view Development Panel in Service Desk requests without Service Desk application access

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4282].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
If you set a Component lead as a non-agent JIRA user and create an issue from the customer portal choosing this component, the issue will be created and assigned to the Component Lead even though he is not an agent.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk Application v3.3.0-OD-1000.335.0
* JIRA v1000.319.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Component in a Service Desk project and set the Component lead to a non-agent user.
# Set the *Default assignee* for the component to the component lead.
# Make sure that the non-agent user is in the *Service Desk Team* role which means they have *Assignable User* permission on the project.
# Create an issue through the customer portal choosing the component you just created in step 1.

h3. Expected Results
The issue is either unassigned or an error message is thrown as the user is not a Service Desk agent.

h3. Actual Results
Issue is created with the non-agent user as the *Assignee*.
fields.summary: In JIRA Service Desk, the default assignee can be set to a non agent
JIRA Issue Search Plugin allow user typing "Project" clause even Project clause won't support

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4277].
  {panel}

I'm glad to see that we can now enter date times as text on requests (since many users find the time portion of the picker confusing), but it needs to be more forgiving of trivial formatting differences. I really don't think a single, rigid format is sufficient.

Ideally these should all be handled the same, for example:
* 8/30/16 4:30 pm (this is the one that works in our setup)
* 8/30/16 4:30pm
* 8/30/16 4:30p
* 8/30/16 16:30
* 8/30/16 1630

Perhaps it could just reuse the existing date format, with an option for smarter time parsing?

The date portion is less critical I think (since the picker for this is intuitive), but it would still be nice if you could enter 8/30 and it would assume the current year.
fields.summary: Date Time entry needs to be more flexible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4276].
  {panel}

We've got multiple small projects, each having it's own list of customers. There are many groups of projects with same character, therefore they have got same request types configuration.

We would like to have ability to define request type scheme, and share it for multiple projects. Same as Issue Type Scheme, Screen Schemes,...

However, some projects are isolated. And, their PM would like to have an access to the request type configuration.

Therefore I suggest, that it would be possible to define request type scheme, which would work in two modes:
 * *project local request type scheme* - users with permission to administer project (project manager, project administrator) should be able to modify the request type scheme
 * *shared request type scheme* - only JIRA administrators have the ability to modify these request type scheme
fields.summary: Request type schemes
Display version compatibility information on "Versions & licenses" page
Add "Last commented by customer" or similar as a field option

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently there is only tab for Gmal and Yahoo. Office365 requires the username in your SMTP configuration to be your full email address, which includes the domain. For example: your_username@yourOffice365domain.com

h3. Suggested Solution
To have another tab for Microsoft Office365 which will restrict username format to prevent the [Office365 SMTP configuration receives authentication errors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/office365-smtp-configuration-receives-authentication-errors-646250764.html] problem to happen in the first place.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4269].
  {panel}

Currently the HTML parser in JSD attempts to convert the content of a message to wiki markup. 

In most cases this works just fine. However, some mail clients (e.g. Airmail) add rgba-colors to each paragraph (which are just black though) and this results in very annoying lines in the body of the received content stating:

{quote}
color: Color value is invalid 
{quote}

This makes the message pretty unreadable. An example:

{quote}
color: Color value is invalid

Hello,
color: Color value is invalid
color: Color value is invalid

Can you guys please take a look at this and that?
color: Color value is invalid

If you need some help, just let me know!
color: Color value is invalid
color: Color value is invalid

Best regards,
Dennis
{quote}

These errors are outputted the same as the content: same size, same color so they are essentially part of the body. Why these errors have to be shown here, I don't know. In my opinion they do not add anything useful and makes working with JSD a lot more impractical.

Atlassian support recommended to change the renderer to "Default Text Renderer" but this results in seeing the raw wiki code instead, including all the color tags. 

If one provides an incorrect color (as there is no validation) in Confluence its simply shown in the default color (black). However, JSD outputs all errors in the body, where it shouldn't be.

Please hide these errors from the description.
fields.summary: Do not display non-functional errors of mail parsing in description

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4265].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
As Described in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-30161 a service desk customer cannot view KB articles for a linked Confluence Space If Anonymous access is enabled for the space.  BUT the customers can partially View the content when browsing in the service desk customer portal.  Once the content is selected it fails to load, causing an overall confusing and negative customer experience as content displayed should be accessable.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Service Desk Linked to KB
* Anonymously accessable Confluence Space

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# [Configure Service desk KB Link | https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER032/Serving+customers+with+a+knowledge+base]
# Set the space linked to the portal as anonymously accessable
# Logged into the portal as a Service desk customer search for content 
# Select the link to the content populated in the search results *Solutions from knowledge base*

h3. Expected Results
*Either:*
- the Content is not populated by the search results as the current permissions for the customer will prevent them from viewing the content 

*OR:*
- the Content will load once selected

h3. Actual Results
Service Desk Customer selects link to suggested article displayed (Showing partial content) in the portal search results but is presented with an behavior described in {{https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-30161}} and cannot access the content displayed from the portal through the oAuth link

h3.Workaround
# For a customer to view content without confusion, *disable anonymous access* to the space and set up the KB link as described here:
## https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/guide-to-link-knowledge-base-to-jira-service-desk-for-unlicensed-user-816677228.html
# The Service Desk Customer Must Log out to access the content anonymously
fields.summary: Unauthenticated Service Desk Customers can browse but not View Confluence Linked KB

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4263].

h3. Problem Definition

When you have Service Desk integrated with a Confluence Knowledge base you can see search results for related articles from within JIRA. However these search results appear to be limited to only 3 results in this view. Conversely looking at the confluence space directly results many more search results.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be nice if within the project configuration within Service Desk that you could customize the number of expected search results. At the moment this does not appear possible.
h3. Workaround

Current method of using the [Label restrictions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver031/serving-customers-with-a-knowledge-base-802164866.html#Servingcustomerswithaknowledgebase-LabelsHowtosuggestarticlesforspecificrequesttypes] might be helpful in some cases, but it does not allow for more results to be displayed.
fields.summary: Configure the number of search results returned by Service Desk Knowledgebase search
Option to block the issue creation through email when the email channel is enabled.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4261].
  {panel}

h4. +Scenario+
In certain cases, it may happen that:
# project SD1 has customers sd1cus1, sd1cus2
# project SD2 has customers sd2cusA, sd2cusB

(i) in other words, they have 2 totally different customer lists

In such a case like this, the 2 projects should be allowed to use the same email address for Email requests, in which:
* if sd1cus1 sends an email to this email address, JIRA detects that this customer belongs to SD1 only and will raise a request in SD1
* if sd2cusA sends an email to this email address, JIRA detects that this customer belongs to SD2 only and will raise a request in SD2

h4. +Suggestion+
When multiple SD projects meet the following requirements:
# each project has a distinct customer list in which no customer exists in more than one service desk
# public signup is not allowed and all projects have Request Security set to "Only people on my customers list"

they should be allowed to use the same email address for Email requests.
fields.summary: Allow multiple Service Desks with distinct customer lists to use the same Email Address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4260].
  {panel}

We are using JIRA, JIRA Servicedesk and Confluence, with Confluence also serving as a knowlegde base for our customers at the Servicedesk.

In Confluence it is possible to use JIRA links, powerful and useful! However, if one uses such a link in a Confluence space accessible to customers (who can only access the Servicedesk Portal) the JIRA links are dead to them. This is not well understood by our customers and does limit the combined power of Confluence and JIRA Servicedesk greatly. 

What would make the combination of JIRA Servicedesk and Confluence much more powerfull would be an extra authentication step with JIRA links in Confluence; 
* if a person has user-access to JIRA, wave through
* if a person has SD-customer-portal acces, send through to the customer portal view
* If a person has no JIRA access, show notification 'you are not authorised'

If this would become possible, we could use the JIRA-macro's in Confluence for a great many more purposes;
* Release notes
* Customer specific reports
* Interactive link in Questions (e.g. the following ticket has been created based on this discussion)
* ... etc. 

"Workaround" is to include the SD-portal link in Confluence, but this is a) no JIRA-link and b) not interactive
fields.summary: Confluence + JIRA Servicedesk > Linked JIRA issues are dead to Servicedesk Portal customers

h3. Summary

Security Level field is available to be added in the Request types field configuration in Service Desk.

h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud 1000.305.0
JIRA Service Desk Application - 3.3.0-OD-1000.259.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new Issue Security configuration in your project settings
# Go to your *Project settings* > *Request types* > *Edit fields* > *Add a field*

h3. Expected Results

Security Level is an unsupported field and should not be available to be added as stated in the product documentation: [Configuring request types and workflows|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-request-types-and-workflows-732528910.html#Configuringrequesttypesandworkflows-HiddenFieldsHiddenfieldsandunsupportedfields]

h3. Actual Results

The field is available to be added and will show in the Hidden section where you can add a preset value. This value may be reset or the field removed automatically from the request type fields.
fields.summary: Security Level available to be added in the request type field settings

h3. Summary

When removing the 'Service Desk Customer - Portal Access' role from the 'Delete Issues' project permission, JIRA Service Desk indicates there is an issue with the Permission scheme.
h3. Environment

Cloud - JST v3.3.0-OD-1000.259.0
Server - Current

 !permissionschemeerror.png|thumbnail! 
  

Users in the Service Desk Customer - Portal Access role do not have the ability to delete issues therefore this permission can be left in place.

The current workaround is to leave this group within the project role.

{panel:title=Update as of 9 May 2017}
Hello Cloud customers and evaluators,

Great news - your customers can now search and view knowledge base articles without logging in to the portal. We've added the option to make your portals login-free, so customers can:
 * browse knowledge base articles in the portal without logging in
 * read linked articles without logging in
 * find knowledge base articles via search engines

To learn more about login-free portals and set up your own, [check out our release blog|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/blog/2017/04/introducing-the-login-free-portal].

Cheers,
The JIRA Service Desk Team
{panel}
As a customer I would like to have the option to make my knowledge base public so the users won't have to log in the customer portal to search for articles.

Workaround.

Make the confluence space public, but this will make the customer have access to the whole page tree.
fields.summary: Public access knowledge base.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4239].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

As per the [JIRA Service Desk 3.2.x Release Notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-2-x-release-notes-830281732.html], it is currently not possible to upgrade directly from JIRA 6.4.x and Service Desk 2.5.9 to JIRA Core 7.2.x with JIRA Service Desk 3.2.x. Hence, customers running on JIRA 6.4.x will have to *upgrade twice, increasing their downtime* and also the upgrade effort to go to JIRA 7.2.x and JSD 3.2.x.
h3. Suggested Solution

As a JIRA administrator, I would like to be able to upgrade from JIRA 6.4.x and JSD 2.5.9 to JIRA 7.2 and JIRA Service Desk 3.2 directly so that I can perform a single upgrade.

h3. Workaround

The following [jira-config.properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer070/Advanced+JIRA+application+configuration#AdvancedJIRAapplicationconfiguration-jira-config.propertiesThejira-config.propertiesfile] parameters can be used when upgrading from JIRA 6.4 to 7.0 and Service Desk 3.0:
{code}
jira.upgrade.force.manual.schedule=true
jira.autoexport=false
{code}

This will cause the intermediate upgrade path ( JIRA 6.4 -> JIRA 7.0 -> JIRA 7.2 ) to occur much faster as JIRA performs an export and re-index normally as part of the upgrade which takes a long time in larger environments and is unnecessary for intermediate upgrade versions. These parameters can be removed when upgrading JIRA 7 to JIRA 7.2
fields.summary: As a JIRA Service Desk administrator, I would like to be able to upgrade from JSD 2.5.9 to 3.2 directly

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, a user should be added to _site-admins_ group to have the permission to reset the password of customer accounts. It would be a good idea to provide a functionality to allow a specific user to reset customer accounts. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an ability to allow a specific user to reset customer accounts.
fields.summary: Ability to allow a specific user to reset customer accounts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4236].
  {panel}

h3. Problem definition
Service Desk mail handler will not read and process emails for a mailbox which has delegated access to another mailbox.
# Turn on [delegate access|https://support.office.com/en-us/article/Allow-someone-else-to-manage-your-mail-and-calendar-41c40c04-3bd1-4d22-963a-28eafec25926?ui=en-US&rs=en-US&ad=US&fromAR=1] for your Exchange mail account, call it "mailbox A".
# Delegate the Editor access (or grant full permission) to another mailbox, call it "mailbox B".
# Use "mailbox B" as the email channel for a Service Desk project.
# Send an email to "mailbox A".
# The email will not be read and processed to create as request in the Service Desk project.

h3. Suggested solution
Make it possible to read and process the emails in "mailbox A"
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like to be able to create request from email using delegated mailbox access

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Summary

While this request is similar to that in JSDCLOUD-2015 Automation to edit issue fields using defined values, because it relates to Issue-level Security and permissions rather than simply setting field values, I thought to log a separate Suggestion.

Using the ticket linked above as a guide:

It would be nice to see an automation "THEN" function that allows the setting of an Issue Security level.

h3. Workaround

Add *Group (atlassian-addons-admin)* to the Issue Security Levels so that A4J can modify the triggered issue.
fields.summary: Automation to be able to set Issue Security level

h3. Summary
When using the unlicensed user functionality toward Confluence, as an unlicensed user, the articles list is not showing from the 'Find a solution box'
 !Selection_197.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment
* Confluence 5.10.4
* JSD 3.1.9


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure [JIRA and Confluence Application link|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/guide-to-link-knowledge-base-to-jira-service-desk-for-unlicensed-user-816677228.html] is configured and using the same user base
# Create a customer account through JSD portal
# Try to search for an article

h3. Expected Results
# List of articles should be listed

h3. Actual Result
# No articles shown
 
h3. Notes
* *Assigning* the customer account to JSD application access, allow the account to search for articles correctly. This, however will consume JSD license
* *Revoking* the customer account to JSD application access, will continue to  allow the account to search for articles correctly. (seems to be a workaround)
[video|https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B7c2il3hFpA0Q3NsY01tbmswaFU/view?usp=sharing]
fields.summary: Knowledge Base for unlicensed user not showing

Today, a customer can only access to a request which he/she is a reporter, or a participant. There's no way to allow some customers to view other/all requests, or to make some requests viewable by all customers

To make the visibility of requests configurable via Issue Security

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4224].
  {panel}

I wanted to add approvals to my IT helpdesk workflow, so I made a copy of that workflow and tried to add approvals to it.
 It did not work because the approvals button was not shown:

!image-2016-08-30-18-17-30-882.png|width=657,height=323!

However, when I edit the active workflow directly from the service desk project, it is there.

!image-2016-08-30-18-18-11-877.png|width=654,height=325!

This is a bit of an inconvenience because I cannot make all the changes I want to an inactive workflow and then set it active.

I understand why it is not shown - because in its inactive state there probably is no connection to service desk for that workflow. Would be nice if you could make this possible nonetheless.
fields.summary: Approvals option should be shown even if workflow not edited from service desk

h3. Problem Definition
Currently in JIRA Service Desk when agent creates an KB article from an issue the new KB will be created in the same space which Service Desk project connects to and the page will be published therefore accessible immediately par the customer. h3. Summary

Upgrading Service desk to 3.2 from a version <= 2.5.x breaks project navigation sidebar
h3. Environment

When attempting to upgrade a Service Desk instance from a version <= 2.5.x directly to 3.2.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create XML backup from existing JIRA 6.4.x instance running Service Desk 2.5.x
 # Install a fresh instance of Service Desk 3.2.0
 # Use the 'import existing data' link to restore this XML backup
 # Navigate to a Service Desk Project, and look at the side bar for project navigation

Given that the [official release notes for Service Desk 3.2.0|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-2-x-release-notes-830281732.html] indicate that upgrades must have upgraded to Service Desk 3.0 first, the expected results should be that the JIRA upgrade completes, but the Service Desk upgrade tasks should not have been run on this instance.

h3. Notes

While service desk does appear to start up, the sidebar navigation appear to be corrupted for all existing Service Desk projects and new Service Desk projects. The top of the navigation menu has the error "Unable to render element due to an error"

!jsd32unabletorender.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

*Option 1*
 # [Rollback|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/rolling-back-a-jira-application-upgrade-802592268.html] the JIRA upgrade first
 # Then upgrade to a Service Desk version such as 3.0.10 (Corresponds to JIRA Server 7.0.10)
 # Once this upgrade is complete, you should then be able to upgrade JIRA to 7.2 and Service Desk to 3.2

*Option 2*
 Follow the directions in the "resolution 1" section of [After upgrade to JIRA Service Desk 3.2.0 Service Desk project navigation bar shows unable to render element due to an error|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/after-upgrading-to-jira-service-desk-3-2-0-service-desk-project-s-navigation-bar-shows-unable-to-render-element-due-to-an-error-845943102.html]
fields.summary: Upgrading Service Desk to 3.2 from a version <= 2.5.x breaks project navigation sidebar

h5. Summary

The Customer Portal Documentation for JSD 3.0.x, 3.1.x, 3.2.x, and Cloud all have a screenshot of the Help Center from 2.x. This is confusing to customers, because there is no option to display their service desks like this in JSD 3.x without enabling the dark feature mentioned in this ticket: [https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-3898|JSD-3898].

h5. Affected Pages

[Configuring the customer portal - Cloud|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-the-customer-portal-732528918.html]
[Configuring the customer portal - 3.2.x|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SERVICEDESKSERVER032/Configuring+the+customer+portal]

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4207].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
As soon as a user is added to an issue as an approver, that user is treated as a customer for the purposes of notifications, even if they're an agent. Unless they then remove themselves after approving a given issue, they'll miss out on receiving any subsequent internal notifications.

h3. Suggestion
If a user is added as an approver to an issue, if they're an agent, keep treating them as an agent for the purposes of notifications.

The use case here is when a customer is set as an approver and merely replies via email saying "This is approved" but doesn't visit the portal to actually click the Approve button. The agent can add herself to the Approvers field and manually approve it to transition the issue through the workflow.
fields.summary: Approvers should not be always treated as customers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4206].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When granting Project Permission to a Single User, the suggested users list includes Customers. If we proceed with granting the permission to the customer, it will be successful but in fact a customer can never use the granted permission. 
* This is very confusing as it appears that an admin can grant a project permission to a customer but it doesn't work actually.

h3. Suggestions
* Do not suggest Customers in the user picker field in the Project Permission page.
* Label a customer as Customers in the suggested users list.
* Display a warning when an admin is granting permission to a customer.
fields.summary: As an admin, I am confused when a customer appears in the user suggestion list when I'm granting Project Permissions to Single User

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4205].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Due to the fact that the IF clause in the Service Desk automation rules has a "Comment contains" option, it would be beneficial to be able to change the value of a field based on the comment contents
Changing field values through the THEN clause currently is not possible.

h3. Suggested Solution
The option to change field values in the THEN clause should not be exclusive to the "Comment contains" IF option, the below just serves as an example.
If the automation rule contains a certain string, say "priority=x", the THEN clause should have to option change the value of the priority field.
This would allow for customers to set the priority of their requests through comments or email, which currently is not possible.
A feature request exists [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-1393] which has been indicated to not getting implemented, though the method in that request is limited to the priority field, whereas this feature request could cover other (custom) fields as well.
fields.summary: Allow automation rules to change field values

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4204].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Due to the fact that the IF clause in the Service Desk automation rules has a "Comment contains" option, it would be beneficial to be able to assign issues to a particular Agent.
Request assignment in the THEN clause currently is not possible.

h3. Suggested Solution
The option to assign issues to a user in the THEN clause should not be exclusive to the "Comment contains" IF option, the below just serves as an example.
If the automation rule contains a certain string, say "assign to agent x", the THEN clause should have to option "assign to user" and pick a user from a dropdown menu
fields.summary: Add assign to a user as Automation option

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4202].
  {panel}

h2.Summary

Sometimes customer request are directly sent to the agent's email. Some company has auto forwarding configurations to automatically divert all customer mails from agent's email to Service Desk mail handler.

Zendesk has a feature known as 'Sent Through' that allows you to detect the where the mail is being forwarded from. With this feature, the customer request can be assigned to the specific agent the email is sent to before being forwarded.

It's a good feature to have.
fields.summary: 'Sent Through' feature for JIRA Service Desk

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4200].
  {panel}

h3. Problem 
The fields in the SLAs panel are not translated to other languages when the application default language is set to other languages such as French, German and etc.
The fields are also not translatable using the InProduct Translation plugin.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Log in to JIRA as an admin.
# Go to {{JIRA Administration > System > General configuration}}, change the *Default Language* to any other language, for example Spanish.
# Open an existing issue which SLAs panel is present.
# Check on the fields in the SLAs panel.

h3. Expected Result
The field name in the SLAs panel are as the default language.

h3. Actual Result
The field name (Time to resolution) in the SLAs panel are still display in English.
 !field.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Fields in the SLAs panel are not translated and not translatable
Update the JSD Satisfaction Survey trend reports to not indicate a "0" result for days customers have not submitted a survey

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4197].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When you create an issue using Service Desk customer portal, then you add a link to another issue using "[issue key]" pattern, thumbnail is missing as shown in attachment. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud Service Desk with customer portal enabled 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service desk project and enable costumer portal. (use [wiki style renderer] for description and comments).
# Create an issue type with customized icon/update an existing issue type with customized icon
# Create an issue with the issue type created above
# Go to customer portal and create an issue, in description insert an issue key into "[]" for displaying as a link and show thumbnail.
# The thumbnail will show a browser missing image icon (attached image).

h3. Expected Results
Show the thumbnail with a preview from the referenced issue.

h3. Actual Results
The thumbnail appear as a missing image icon.

h3. Notes
tried to give "browse projects" permission on the project from which you're referencing an issue from, to "Service Desk Customer - Portal Access" entity, even though the logged user already had this permission.

h3.Workaround
Found no suitable workaround.
fields.summary: When inserting a issue link in description or comment and viewing from Customer Portal, thumbnail is missing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4196].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when users set automation rules and they fail to execute in an event. Then there is no quick way to verify if the parameters have any issues. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be easier if we have an automation helper, where users could specify values for the variables and test if the rule would execute, just like the permission and notification helper in JIRA.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like to have an Automation Rules Helper to verify if the rule would execute if certain parameters are given

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4195].
  {panel}

Quite often the agent has more than a just a few attachments on the issue. 

As it is right now she needs to publish the attachment thru adding a comment. Fair and square and probably a safety net to prevent all attachments to be published out. 

However, when having a lot of attachments on the issue, the process of finding out which attachment is public and which is not, is a tad tedious. Either crosschecking portal view vs issue view or crosschecking attachments on issue with comments. 

Can we get som sort of symbol to mark up which attachment is visible to the customer?

br
Lisa
fields.summary: Visualize which attachments are published on the customer portal

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4187].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
The [Pagination|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/3.1.4/#pagination] used in JIRA Service Desk REST API does not return consistent results

h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk REST API

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a GET request for Customer Requests
{code:borderStyle=solid}
<baseURL>/rest/api-name/resource-name?start=0&limit=10
{code}
# Observe the "size" from the result
{code:borderStyle=solid|title=Results}
  "size": 76,
  "start": 0,
  "limit": 100,
  "isLastPage": true,
{code}
# Change the {{start}} to a higher value and re-send the GET request
# {code:borderStyle=solid}
<baseURL>/rest/servicedeskapi/request?start=20&limit=100
{code}
# Observe the "size" from the result
{code:borderStyle=solid|title=Results}
  "size": 36,
  "start": 20,
  "limit": 100,
  "isLastPage": true,
{code}
# Change the {{start}} to a higher value and re-send the GET request
# {code:borderStyle=solid}
<baseURL>/rest/servicedeskapi/request?start=30&limit=100
{code}
# Observe the "size" from the result
{code:borderStyle=solid|title=Results}
  "size": 16,
  "start": 30,
  "limit": 100,
  "isLastPage": true,
{code}


h3. Expected Results
From the above example, Pagination should return 56 and 46 respectively

h3. Actual Results
Returned values are not 56 and 46 respectively
 
h3. Notes
JIRA Service Desk REST API is still an experimental release as per [this comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-107?focusedCommentId=853509&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-853509]

h3.Workaround
No workaround as of now
fields.summary: Inconsistent JIRA Service Desk REST API Pagination

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4182].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The 'resolution' field is not indexed by JIRA when hidden. This has two main consequences in Service Desk reports:
# The 'resolved' series in reports, such as Created vs Resolved don't show issues in this case
# If an issue is resolved while the resolution is hidden, if we change it to 'show', these issues are not shown in report as resolved, unless system is re-indexed

h3. Environment
Version: 3.3.0-OD-1000.212.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an SD project
# Make resolution hidden in Fields Configuration
# Create tickets and resolve them
# Check Created vs Resolved reports
# Make resolution visible again 
# Check Created vs Resolved reports

h3. Expected Results
The resolve tickets show in report both in steps 4 and 6.

h3. Actual Results
Both won't show any resolved issues. 
 
h3. Notes
There's a similar bug [here|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-38224]. 

Notice that you resolve a ticket *before hiding the field*, hide it and show it again, the ticket will show once the field is not hidden. That's probably because it was indexed by resolution, since it was visible when the ticket was resolved.

On the other hand, if you resolve the ticket *while the field is hidden*, it won't show unless you run a re-index.

Also, re-indexing while the field is hidden is useless and may just remove the existing indices for tickets created before it was hidden.

h3.Workaround
If you need to see the field in reports:
# Make it visible again
# Lock JIRA and re-index
# Keep it visible (otherwise, the problem will occur again)
# If you don't want users to see/edit this field, simply remove it from screens (Created/View/Edit)
fields.summary: Hidden Resolution field is not shown in reports

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4177].
  {panel}

*Description of problem*
Reports page in JIRA Service Desk project does not load when base URL is "http://projects"

*Steps to reproduce:*
* Create new JIRA instance with JIRA Service Desk, create Service Desk project.
* Configure Base URL to be "projects"
* Run JIRA on port 80
* Configure DNS to properly resolve "projects" hostname to the JIRA server
* Attempt to access reports page in JIRA Service Desk project by clicking the "reports" link in the project sidebar
** Notice that this page never loads. The waiting spinner shows and does not go away. 

The individual reports pages do continue to work without problems. 
* Working: http://projects/projects/DESK/reports/workload
* Working: http://projects:8080/projects/DESK/reports
* Not Working: http://projects/projects/DESK/reports

*Expected behavior:*
Reports page loads regardless of base URL

*Workaround:*
Change Base URL or access reports directly instead of using the left side project sidebar. 
* Note that you can add a [project shortcut | https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver071/project-shortcuts-802172412.html] that points to an individual report to make navigation easier.
fields.summary: Reports page does not load when base URL is "http://projects"

h3. Problem Definition

You can change Issue Types in JIRA using the *Move* function in the issue screen. When you use this function to move Service Desk issues, then the request type is lost when you change the Issue Type in the move.

The workaround would be that to set the request type right after the move in the issue view by editing the request type field inline. However, this is not ideal as if forgotten or not done, then the issue is not viewable via the customer portal and so the issue could potentially be stuck waiting for customer but the customer has no visibility on it.
h3. Suggested Solution

Include in the JIRA Issue Type move functionality the ability to specify the request type in the move function itself for Service Desk tickets so that the issue will have a request type as soon as the move is complete.
fields.summary: As a user, for service desk tickets, I want JIRA to prompt users to set request type when performing a move operation to change Issue Type

h4. +Summary+
In some cases:
* customers may only be interested in knowing the current status of their requests together with updated comments from support team
_OR_
* support team prefers the status change log to be hidden as a lot of status changes might be involved without comments

(/) the reason is the status change log may become unnecessarily lengthy after some time, distracting customers from the really important content

(i) this is currently not configurable in JIRA Service Desk, and the status change log is always visible in the customer portal

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4167].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The approver doesn't get any other notification than the one to approve the ticket even if they are also set as the request assignee and are watching the request as well.

Also after removing that user as the approver, still no notifications are sent to them.

 
h3. Environment

Reproduced on JIRA Cloud version: 1000.245.1

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

*Case 1:*
 # In JIRA Service Desk create a service request that needs approval (e.g. purchase request)
 # Set the same user as approver, assignee and watcher
 # Add couple of comments to the request (internal and public)

*Case 2:*
 # In JIRA Service Desk create a service request that needs approval (e.g. purchase request)
 # Set the same user as assignee and watcher
 # Add couple of comments and see that you get the notifications for those comments
 # Add the same user as the approver for the request

 
h3. Expected Results

In both cases the expected result is that the user get notifications for all the comments and status changes

 
h3. Actual Results

*Case 1:*
 - The user only receives the notification that the request needs approval

*Case 2:*
 - The user receives the notifications up until step #3. Then, after getting the approval notification they stop getting any other notification

 
h3. Notes

If you approve the request, then removing the user as the approver does not fix the issue since the user is still set as the one that approved the request.

 
h3. Workaround

None at the moment.
fields.summary: Issue approver doesn't get any other notification than the one to approve the request, even if they are also Watcher and/or Assignee in JIRA Service Desk Cloud

  {panel}

h3. Summary

If we change the 'Default Language' to Spanish or German, whenever we create a Basic SD project or an IT Service Desk project, we get:

In Basic SD only, we can see in the project this error:
{code:java}This service desk project has configuration problems and may not work as expected.
View error details and repair the problem
{code}
Clicking the link we get this:
{code:java}Request Form contains configuration errors
The following fields don't have any values set:
	•	¿Qué sistema?
As a consequence these Request Forms cannot be used successfully by customers:
	•	Solicitar una nueva cuenta
To repair these Request Forms, add values for these fields on this project's components page.
{code}
Both in Basic and IT projects, no queues are created for this project. Going to the Queues page show a message saying no queues exist:
 !queues.png|thumbnail!
h3. Environment

Affected version (not available in the field): 3.3.0-OD-1000.164.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In General Configuration page, change 'Default Language' to 'Spañol' (Spanish)/ Deutsch (German)
 # Create an SD project

h3. Expected Results
 # Queues are created

h3. Actual Results

No Queue is created. In Basic projects, the errors mentioned before are shown.
h3. Partial Workaround

*This workaround will make you project be entirely in English*
 # Change 'Default Language' to English
 # Create the project
 # Change it back to Spanish/German

h3. Workaround (JIRA Server Only)

A file inside of the JIRA Service Desk .obr file must be modified. The temporary workaround is to remove the trailing space on one line in sd-i18n_de_DE.properties.
 * jira-servicedesk-application-3.1.10.obr\jira-servicedesk-application-3.1.10.jar\i18n\sd-i18n_de_DE.properties
{noformat}sd.workflow.name.for.purchase=JIRA Service Desk Kauf-Workflow wurde f\u00FCr das Projekt {0} generiert 
{noformat}

See [JIRA Service Desk Internationalization |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Service+Desk+Internationalization] for instructions on modifying the i18n file. After making this change uninstall JIRA Service Desk from the Versions & Licenses page and then install the modified .obr file using the Upload an Application option on the Versions & Licenses page.
fields.summary: SD projects created when Default Language is Spanish or German don't have queues and show error

h3. Problem Definition

h3. Suggested Solution

*Hi all,*

*This is a future consideration for our roadmap and is not in our short term roadmap.*

h3. Problem Definition
Often in the Connectivity log panel, there will be _FAILURE_ status indicating an issue, resulting an alternating _FAILURE_ and _SUCCESS_ statuses (see example [^connectivity_log_1.png] and [^connectivity_log_2.png]). However, it does not clearly reflect the duration of a _FAILURE_ occurred or should it be a concern to the administrators.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDSERVER-4150].
  {panel}

*Background*

1. We use JIRA and Service Desk.
 2. For each client we have an internal JIRA project and an external Service Desk project.
 3. JIRA issues and Service Desk requests display on an internal Kanban board.
 4. Both JIRA and Service Desk use matching workflow.

*Problem*

For our Service Desk projects, *designers* and *developers* are Service Desk Agents because the Service Team Member role is too restricted. Specifically, these internal staff members can't:

1. Update the Assignee field
 2. Transition issues through the workflow (even through customers can do this)

Having so many Service Desk Agents is expensive and was not our intended outcome when we set up Service Desk. 

*Workaround*

The workaround offered by Atlasssian support is to create a linked JIRA issue for each relevant Service Desk request. This is not acceptable as it creates duplicate issues and we will mess with time-tracking.

*Desire outcome*

Extend the Service Team Member permissions to include the following items:

1. Ability to update the assignee field
 2. Ability to transition an issue through a workflow
fields.summary: Extend permissions of Service Team members

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

h3. Problem Definition
There are some shops that work solely out of e-mail. Automation doesn't currently allow for auto assignment based on the from e-mail reply of an agent. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Build automation feature to evaluate e-mail replies and auto assign to agents. 

h3. Workaround 
# Create statuses for each agent. 
# Create transition from waiting for support to each agent status (i.e. Agent1, Agent2, Agent3). 
# Create automation rules for each agent that transitions the issue to each agent status based on a specific value (i.e. #agent1 #agent2 #agent3)
# Create post function that auto assigns agent for each transition to agent status. 
# For each request type be sure to rename Agent statuses to "Waiting for customer"

Although you now have different statuses that would replace "Waiting for customer" status. From the customers perspective it will appear as Waiting for customer. 

References: 

- [Customize status for request type for reference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/configuring-request-types-and-workflows-732528910.html#Configuringrequesttypesandworkflows-CustomizingWorkflowCustomizetheworkflowstatusesforarequesttype]
- [Configuring Workflows|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/working-with-workflows-776636540.html]
- [Automating your Service Desk|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskcloud/automating-your-service-desk-732528900.html]
fields.summary: Auto assign issue based on agent e-mail reply.
